domains.title: Priority of the Problem
domains.description: Is the problem a priority? Consider the burden of disease, urgency, and whether addressing it would reduce health inequities.
domains.guidance: Consider: disease burden (morbidity, mortality, disability), urgency of the problem, and existing gaps in care. Reference WHO Global Health Observatory data when available.

fields.label: Justification
fields.placeholder: Explain the rationale for your judgment...

fields.label: Research Evidence
fields.placeholder: Summarize relevant evidence on the priority of this problem...

domains.title: Certainty of Evidence
domains.description: What is the overall certainty of the evidence of effects? Assessed using GRADE criteria: risk of bias, inconsistency, indirectness, imprecision, and publication bias.
domains.guidance: Rate using GRADE levels. Consider all critical outcomes. Downgrade for: risk of bias, inconsistency, indirectness, imprecision, publication bias. Upgrade for: large effect, dose-response, plausible confounding.

fields.label: Justification
fields.placeholder: Explain key factors influencing the certainty rating...

fields.label: Summary of Findings
fields.placeholder: Reference Summary of Findings (SoF) table if available...

domains.title: Balance of Benefits and Harms
domains.description: Does the balance between desirable and undesirable effects favor the intervention or the comparison?
domains.guidance: Consider the magnitude and importance of both desirable effects (benefits) and undesirable effects (harms). Weigh these against each other considering the certainty of each.

fields.label: Undesirable Effects
fields.placeholder: Describe anticipated harms and adverse effects...

domains.title: Values and Preferences
domains.description: Is there important uncertainty about or variability in how much people value the main outcomes?
domains.guidance: Consider whether patients/populations have consistent values regarding the outcomes, or whether there is significant variability. Values may differ by culture, socioeconomic status, or individual circumstances.

scale.label: Probably no important uncertainty or variability

fields.label: Justification
fields.placeholder: Describe evidence on patient/population values and preferences...

fields.label: Research Evidence
fields.placeholder: Summarize studies on values and preferences...

domains.title: Resource Requirements (Costs)
domains.description: How large are the resource requirements (costs) of the intervention?
domains.guidance: Consider direct and indirect costs, resource use, and the perspective (health system, societal, patient). Consider cost relative to the setting and available budget.

fields.label: Research Evidence
fields.placeholder: Summarize cost data or economic evaluations...

domains.title: Cost-Effectiveness
domains.description: Does the cost-effectiveness of the intervention favor the intervention or the comparison?
domains.guidance: Consider incremental cost-effectiveness ratios (ICERs), willingness-to-pay thresholds, and how cost-effectiveness may vary across settings.

fields.label: Research Evidence
fields.placeholder: Reference economic evaluations or cost-effectiveness analyses...

domains.title: Equity, Equality, and Non-Discrimination
domains.description: What would be the impact on health equity?
domains.guidance: Consider whether the intervention would increase or decrease health inequities. Think about access for disadvantaged populations, gender considerations, geographic disparities, and human rights implications (WHO-INTEGRATE framework).

domains.title: Acceptability
domains.description: Is the intervention acceptable to key stakeholders?
domains.guidance: Consider acceptability to patients, healthcare providers, policymakers, and other key stakeholders. Cultural, ethical, and legal factors may influence acceptability.

domains.title: Feasibility
domains.description: Is the intervention feasible to implement?
domains.guidance: Consider whether the intervention can be implemented in the given setting, considering infrastructure, workforce capacity, supply chain, regulatory environment, and sustainability.
